oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Morris Memorial Building, c.1960
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Photograph of the Morris Memorial Building, located at 330 Charlotte Avenue, c.1960. Completed in 1926, the building was built for the National Baptist Convention to house the Nashville offices of the Sunday School Publishing Board. It was also home to several African American businesses. Built in the Neoclassical style and designed by McKissack and McKissack, the Morris Memorial Building was listed in the National Register of Historic Places in 1985. Photographed by Buford Lewis Co. Forms part of the MDHA Photograph Collection. 1 photograph : b & w.
